Info.Name: Hurricane Sandy
Info.Location: Greater Antilles; Bahamas; most of the eastern United States (especially the coastal Mid-Atlantic States); Bermuda; and eastern Canada

Crisis.HumanImpact: Death toll: 285; loss of power for weeks; people displaced from their homes; damage to modes of transportation
Crisis.EconomicImpact: More than $75 billion in damages; price gouging
Crisis.WaysToHelp: Donate money and supplies, volunteer to help people displaced from their homes

Info.Name: September 11 Attacks
Info.Location: New York City; Arlington County, Virginia; near Shanksville, Pennsylvania

Crisis.HumanImpact: Death toll: 2,996; injured: more than 6,000; health effects: exposure to toxins; increase in patriotism in the U.S.; increase in hate crimes
Crisis.EconomicImpact: Caused serious damage to the economy of Lower Manhattan and had a significant effect on global markets
Crisis.WaysToHelp: Honor victims and support their families

Info.Name: 2004 Indian Ocean Tsunami
Info.Location: Indonesia; Sri Lanka; India; Thailand; Africa

Crisis.HumanImpact: Death toll: 230,210 – 280,000; Food and water shortages; Widespread psychological trauma; Damage to infrastructure
Crisis.EconomicImpact: Contamination of water supplies and farm fields by salt water; Decrease in tourism especially in Thailand

Crisis.HumanImpact: Death toll: 1,464; Levee failures; Damage to infrastructure, transportation, and communication; Civil disturbances (looting, criminal activity, general mass chaos)
Crisis.EconomicImpact: Oil price increases; Costliest disaster in the history of insurance ($45.1 billion, 1.7 million claims)
Crisis.WaysToHelp: Monetary donations. Studying long term effects of Katrina on mental health.

Info.Name: Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill
Info.Location: Gulf of Mexico near Mississippi River Delta, United States

Crisis.HumanImpact: illnesses as the addition of dispersants created PAHs when mixed with crude oil
Crisis.EconomicImpact: Cost of the spill response, containment, relief well drilling, grants to the Gulf states, claims paid, and federal costs; impact to Gulf Coast's economy sectors such as offshore drilling, fishing and tourism
Crisis.ResourcesNeeded: Removed the damaged drilling riser seal off runaway gas wells with nuclear blasts

Info.Name: Weapons of mass destruction in North Korea

Crisis.HumanImpact: Boomerang effect: where the chemicals come and effect the person who dropped the bomb and the targets; Radiation
Crisis.EconomicImpact: Cost for producing the weapon is enormous
Crisis.ResourcesNeeded: Nuclear security and safety standards and inspection on nuclear facilities

Info.Name: West Africa Food Crisis
Info.Location: West Africa: Niger, Mauritania, Mali, Chad and Burkina Faso

Crisis.WaysToHelp: Donate money to CARE or Oxfam

Crisis.EconomicImpact: Over 300 billion in bailout to Greece alone
Crisis.ResourcesNeeded: Money, strong leaders, and economic plans

Info.Name: European Union
Info.Location: Belgium; France; Germany; Italy; Luxembourg; Netherlands

Organization.History: Founded Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, Luxembourg and the Netherlands after WWII in an attempt to secure peace between neighboring countries

Founded in London in July of 1961 by Peter Beneson after reading about two Portuguese students who were imprisoned for “raising a toast to freedom.” A worldwide campsign was launched known as the “Appeal for Amnest 1961.”

Info.Name: International Atomic Energy Agency
Info.Kind: International organization promote the peaceful use of nuclear energy

Organization.History: Dwight D. Eisenhower, proposed the creation of an international body to both regulate and promote the peaceful use of atomic power (nuclear power)

Info.Name: National Wildlife Federation
Info.Kind: Nonprofit conservation education and advocacy organization

Organization.History: Created by Franklin Delano Roosevelt to unite individuals, organizations and agencies interested in the restoration and conservation of wildlife resources

Info.Name: United Nations
Info.Location: 2 United Nations Plaza, New York City, New York, U.S. (International territory)

Organization.History: The United Nations officially came into existence on 24 October 1945, when the Charter had been ratified by China, France, the Soviet Union, the United Kingdom, the United States and by a majority of other signatories. United Nations Day is celebrated on 24 October each year.

Info.Name: CARE
Info.Location: 151 Ellis Street, NE; Atlanta, GA 30303; United States

Organization.History:
CARE was founded right after World War II, on November 27th, 1945. Originally known as the Cooperative for American Remittances to Europe, it aimed at sending food aid and basic supplies to war-torn Europe, in the form of “CARE packages”.
As the economies of the former wartime nations developed and improved, the focus of CARE's work shifted from Europe to the problems of the developing world. CARE is now a proven leader among international humanitarian organizations.

Info.Name: American Red Cross
Info.Location: National Headquarters in Washington D.C., U.S.A.

Organization.History: The American Red Cross was founded by Clara Barton after she became involved in the work of the International Red Cross during the Franco-Prussian War, and decided to bring the organization home with her to America. She expanded the original concept of the Red Cross to include assisting in any great national disaster and became the organization’s first president.

Info.Name: Oxfam
Info.Location: International Headquarters in Oxford, United Kingdom

Organization.History: The name “Oxfam” comes from the Oxford Committee for Famine Relief, founded in Britain in 1942. The group campaigned for food supplies to be sent through an allied naval blockade to starving women and children in enemy-occupied Greece during the Second World War. Oxfam International was formed in 1995 by a group of independent non-governmental organizations. Their aim was to work together for greater impact on the international stage to reduce poverty and injustice.

Info.Name: Bashar al-Assad
Info.Kind: the President of Syria and Regional Secretary of the Syrian-led branch of the Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party

Info.Name: Kenneth Roth
Info.Kind: an American attorney and has been the executive director of Human Rights Watch
